A 30-year-old male athlete reported to the emergency department with severe pain in the right wrist after a fall during a rugby match. Physical examination revealed significant swelling over the dorsal aspect of the wrist and tenderness over the scaphoid. No visible deformities were noted. A 60-year-old woman visited the hospital with complaints of pain and stiffness in her right shoulder, which had worsened over the past month. Physical examination revealed moderate swelling and tenderness over the acromioclavicular joint. There were no deformities noted. A 45-year-old man presented to the clinic with complaints of pain and moderate swelling in the left ankle after a basketball game. On examination, there was tenderness over the lateral malleolus and moderate effusion in the joint. No deformities were observed, and there was no tenderness over the medial malleolus. The range of motion was assessed, revealing flexion of 70° and extension of -5° where "left ankle" is a (Body Structure); "lateral malleolus of the left ankle" is (Body Structure); "medial malleolus of the left ankle" is a (Body Structure); "moderate swelling" is a (Finding) and "moderate" is a (Severity Qualifier); "moderate effusion" is a (Finding) and "moderate" is a (Severity Qualifier); "deformities" is a (Finding); "tenderness" is a (Finding); "flexion" and "extension" are (Observable Entity); "70 degrees" is (Numeric Value); "- minus 5 degrees" is (Numeric Value)

A 35-year-old athlete came to the sports medicine clinic with complaints of aching pain and significant swelling in the right shoulder after a weightlifting session. On examination, there was tenderness over the acromion and significant fluid accumulation in the subacromial bursa. No muscle tears were observed, and there was no tenderness over the clavicle. The range of motion was assessed, revealing abduction of 150° and internal rotation of 30° where "right shoulder" is a (Body Structure); "acromion of the right shoulder" is a (Body Structure); "clavicle of the right shoulder" is a (Body Structure); "significant swelling" is a (Finding) and "significant" is a (Severity Qualifier); "fluid accumulation" is a (Finding); "muscle tears" is a (Finding); "tenderness" is a (Finding); "abduction" is a (Observable Entity); "internal rotation" is a (Observable Entity); "150 degrees" is a (Numeric Value); "30 degrees" is a (Numeric Value)

A 50-year-old office worker presented to the outpatient clinic with complaints of dull pain and mild stiffness in the lower back after prolonged sitting. On examination, there was tenderness over the lumbar vertebrae and mild muscle spasms in the paraspinal muscles. No signs of nerve impingement were observed, and there was no tenderness over the sacroiliac joint. The range of motion was assessed, revealing flexion of 60° and lateral bending of 20° where "lower back" is a (Body Structure); "lumbar vertebrae" is a (Body Structure); "sacroiliac joint" is a (Body Structure); "mild stiffness" is a (Finding) and "mild" a (Severity Qualifier); "muscle spams" is a (Finding); "nerve impingement" is a (Finding); "tenderness" is a (Finding); "flexion" is a (Observable Entity); "lateral bending" is a (Observable Entity); "60 degrees" is a (Numeric Value); "20 degrees" is a (Numeric Value)
